MajorClaims.Text: childhood is the happiest period of one's life
Childhood, in several aspects, is the happiest period of our lives

Claims.Text: It's not only the lack of responsibilities and daily struggle that make childhood the happiest time of our lives, but also factors like learning lots of new things every day and freedom to imagine and say what you think
during our childhood, though responsibilies exist, we are much more free to do what we would like to
childhood is the period of time in which a person is surprised most
Using your imagination and saying what you think freely is another great thing about being a child
It's not only because of the nature of childhood and children, but also the way our lives are changed when we are adults

Premises.Text: Being late for school or laughing at a place where you aren't supposed to do not have consequences as serious as that would be if you were an adult
Starting with our adulthood, we are strictly bounded with our responsibilities in our daily lives
We are told at what hour we shall wake up, how we shall dress up and how we shall behave
Every action we make are watched closely and judged by the community
There are lots of new facts you can learn, stories you can listen to and things you can see
Another great thing about being a child is possibility learning new and interesting things about the world you live in every single day
Being a child means that you are new in this world and every single thing around you is there to be discovered by you
Children are not judged about the things they say as much as the adults, and freedom to express yourself is a very important for developing a colorful imagination
In adulthood, people are forced to express themselves in boundaries
they are in no way free to think or use their imagination
